description: This trap is sent when a user intrudes upon network with invalid
certificate.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiUserwithInvalidCertificate RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 RFC1213-MIB::ifDescr s EXAMPLE HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiTrapInfoMacAddr s EXAMPL HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiTrapInfoAPId i 9999 HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiTrapInfoRadioId i 9999 HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiTrapInfoBSSId s EXAMPL

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: A textual string containing information about the
interface. This string should include the name of the
manufacturer, the product name and the version of the
interface hardware/software.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifDescr

description: The MAC address of the WAPI user.
variables.name: HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiTrapInfoMacAddr

description: To uniquely identify each AP.
variables.name: HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiTrapInfoAPId

description: Represents each radio.
variables.name: HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiTrapInfoRadioId

description: As MAC Address format, it is to identify BSS.
variables.name: HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiTrapInfoBSSId

description: This trap is sent when an attacker records and replays network
transactions.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiStationReplayAttack RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 RFC1213-MIB::ifDescr s EXAMPLE HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiTrapInfoMacAddr s EXAMPL HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiTrapInfoAPId i 9999 HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiTrapInfoRadioId i 9999 HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiTrapInfoBSSId s EXAMPL

variables.name: HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiTrapInfoBSSId

description: This trap is sent when an attacker monitors network traffic and
maliciously changes data in transit(for example, an attacker may
modify the contents of a WAI message).
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiTamperAttack RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 RFC1213-MIB::ifDescr s EXAMPLE HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiTrapInfoMacAddr s EXAMPL HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiTrapInfoAPId i 9999 HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiTrapInfoRadioId i 9999 HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiTrapInfoBSSId s EXAMPL

variables.name: HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiTrapInfoBSSId

description: This trap is sent when a station associates AP(Access Point)
creates packet of Unicast Key Negotiation Response with wrong
WIE(WAPI Information Element) of ASUE(Authentication Supplicant
Entity).

event.Summary: Invalid WAPI information element in unicast key negotiation response packet

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiLowSafeLevelAttack RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 RFC1213-MIB::ifDescr s EXAMPLE HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiTrapInfoMacAddr s EXAMPL HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiTrapInfoAPId i 9999 HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiTrapInfoRadioId i 9999 HH3C-WAPI-MIB::hh3cwapiTrapInfoBSSId s EXAMPL

description: This trap is sent when an attacker maliciously changes destination
MAC address of WPI(WLAN Privacy Infrastructure) frame.

event.Summary: WPI frame destination address redirection attack detected
